ProductionCapacity.definition: Maximum number of units this supplier can produce in a single time period.

WholesalePrice.definition: Price per unit at which the supplier sells goods to downstream manufacturers.

FleetSize.definition: Number of vehicles owned by the supplier for product delivery.

Inventory.definition: Current number of units physically available in the supplier's inventory.

ProductionCost.definition: Cost incurred by the supplier to produce one unit of product.

relations.name: ArrivingOrders
relations.definition: Units ordered by this supplier from upstream suppliers that arrive in the current period. Since this supplier has no upstream neighbors, this value is always zero.

FactoryCapacity.definition: Maximum number of units the manufacturer can produce in a single time period, constrained by physical and operational limits.

ProductPrice.definition: Selling price per unit of product charged by the manufacturer to downstream distributors.

MachineryCount.definition: Number of active machinery units owned and operated by the manufacturer for production purposes.

ManufacturingCost.definition: Total cost incurred by the manufacturer to produce one unit of product, including labor and overhead.

RawMaterialStock.definition: Current inventory level of raw materials available for use in the manufacturing process.

relations.name: DownstreamDemand
relations.definition: Number of product units requested by the downstream distributor from the manufacturer in the current period.

DistributionPrice.definition: The price per unit that the distributor charges to downstream agents for delivered goods.

TruckFleet.definition: The number of trucks owned and operated by the distributor for product delivery.

TransportCost.definition: The cost per unit to transport goods from the distributor to downstream agents.

DeliveryCapacity.definition: The maximum number of units the distributor can deliver in a single time period.

WarehouseStock.definition: The current number of units physically stored in the distributor's warehouse available for delivery.

relations.name: ArrivingOrders
relations.definition: Number of units shipped by the manufacturer and received by the distributor in the current period.

relations.name: DownstreamDemand
relations.definition: Number of units ordered by the wholesaler from the distributor in the current period.

UnitSalePrice.definition: The price at which the wholesaler sells one unit of goods to the downstream retailer.

StoredGoods.definition: The current number of discrete units physically stored in the wholesaler's warehouse.

WarehouseAssets.definition: The total monetary value of the wholesaler's warehouse infrastructure and fixed assets.

HandlingCost.definition: The cost incurred by the wholesaler per unit handled, including labor and operational expenses.

StorageCapacity.definition: The maximum number of discrete units that can be stored in the wholesaler's warehouse at any time.

relations.name: DownstreamDemand
relations.definition: The quantity of units ordered by the downstream retailer from the wholesaler in the current period.

CashReserves.definition: The amount of money the retailer currently has available to cover costs and purchases.

OnHandInventory.definition: Current number of product units physically available in the retailer's store for sale.

StoreCapacity.definition: Maximum number of product units the retailer's store can physically hold at any time.

OperatingCost.definition: Fixed monetary cost the retailer incurs each period to remain operational, regardless of sales or inventory.

RetailPrice.definition: Selling price per unit charged by the retailer to customers.

relations.name: ArrivingOrders
relations.definition: Number of product units shipped by the wholesaler that arrive at the retailer in the current period.
